revision.comment: removed [[Category:People from Yamaguchi Prefecture]]; added [[Category:Military personnel from Yamaguchi Prefecture]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{expand Japanese|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox military person | honorific_prefix = | name = Gaishi Nagaoka
{{nobold|長岡 外史}} | honorific_suffix = | image = Gaishi_Nagaoka.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | birth_name = | other_name = | nickname = | birth_date = {{birth date|1858|06|23}} | birth_place = [[Tsuno District, Yamaguchi|Tsuno District]], [[Tokuyama Domain]], [[Suō Province]], Japan. (Now [[Shūnan, Yamaguchi]]) | death_date = {{Death date and age|1933|04|21|1858|06|23}} | death_place = | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial = | placeofburial_coordinates = | allegiance = [[Empire of Japan]] | branch = [[Imperial Japanese Army]] | serviceyears = | rank = | servicenumber = | unit = | commands = | battles_label = | battles = | awards = | memorials = | spouse = | relations = | laterwork = | signature = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | website = | module = }} {{nihongo|'''Gaishi Nagaoka'''|長岡 外史|Nagaoka Gaishi|extra=June 23, 1858 – April 21, 1933}} was a Japanese military officer. He served in the [[First Sino-Japanese War]] and was Vice Chief of the General Staff in Japan during the [[Russo-Japanese War]]. He became a member of the [[House of Representatives (Japan)|House of Representatives]] in 1924. [[National Archives of Japan]] [https://www.jacar.go.jp/english/nichiro/person.htm Name of persons] Retrieved March 29, 2016 He was known for having the second largest moustache in the world.{{cn|date=April 2016}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category|Gaishi Nagaoka}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nagaoka, Gaishi}} [[Category:1858 births]] [[Category:1933 deaths]] [[Category:Japanese military personnel]] [[Category:Military personnel from Yamaguchi Prefecture]] {{Military-stub}}
